messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Sometimes you dream about a phone call from an old friend. Or you dream that someone close to you dies. This is probably a coincidence. A coincidence is when two things happen at the same time by chance. It does not mean your dream can see the future. And, of course, we probably forget all the times we dream about these things but they do not happen.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text introduces the B2-level word 'coincidence'. According to the rules, introducing vocabulary above A2, even with a definition, is an automatic failure. The goal is to communicate using words the A2 learner already knows, not to teach new, complex vocabulary. The sentence structure is simple and appropriate, but the vocabulary violation is a critical and non-negotiable error.
